sources.autograph: Lucca, Istituto Musicale Boccherini, D.I.33, 'Sonata a quattro no. 9...' Probably a copy, but extremely interesting on account of the detailed accuracy with which the text, the slurs and the expression-marks are recorded. Is it possible that these details are in the hand of Boccherini? In any case, the MS. appears to have been copied from Boccherini's original MS.
ms_copies_score: Lucca, Istituto Musicale Boccherini, B.I.T.4, 'Sonata a quattro no. 9...'
ms_copies_parts: Berlin, Deutsche Staatsbibliothek, M.611A, 'Quartetto no. 3...' A most interesting manuscript, of which the text is identical to that of the manuscript in Lucca, although the order of the works is different. The cover has a note 'Per S.A.R. Monsignore il Principe Hereditario di Prussia', i.e. the future Frederick William II.

Münster, Priesterseminarbibliothek, Santini HS. 531, 'Opera III- Concerto terzo...' The viola and 'cello parts are in the hand of an eighteenth-century copyist; the handwriting of the two violin parts resembles that of Boccherini.

partial_notes: This appears to be a complete entry for G.171 string quartets
